name: Cicero
what_did:
Cicero gave powerful speeches and wrote about laws, justice, and government.
He wanted Rome to stay a republic — where people have a say.
He was one of the best speakers in Roman history.
why_matters:
Cicero’s words influenced how people think about freedom and law.
He showed how powerful good speaking and writing can be.
Many leaders later read his works to learn about politics.

questions.q: What kind of government did Cicero support?
Why is Cicero still read today?
options: His speeches teach freedom and law

fun_fact: Cicero’s name means 'chickpea' — it may have been his family’s old farm crop!
